intro: Allanblackia monticola, commonly known as the African shea tree, is a tropical plant native to western Africa. It is a small to medium-sized tree that thrives in humid, lowland rainforest environments. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish-brown bark and large, glossy, elliptical leaves. Its flowers are small and greenish-yellow, and it produces a unique, sticky fruit that contains valuable seeds. The botanical significance of Allanblackia monticola lies in its role as a source of traditional fats and oils, as well as its ecological importance in its native habitat.
